msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra, elements of the punctuation signs, of the text dividers and of the quire marks; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Several groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1, alternating with black lines; two lines on the incipit page of Texts I-2, I-3, and of subsections of Texts I-1, I-2, I-3 and I-4; initial two or three words of each strophe of Text I-5.

msItem.note: - ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus kähali … "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, mother of Jesus the Almighty ..." (fols. 9rb-va),
- Sälam läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam dǝngǝl ʾǝmmä bǝrhan wä-ʾǝmmä nädd... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Virgin Mary, Mother of the Light and Mother of the Flame ..." (fols. 9va-10vb).
Some miracles are not numbered. The first miracle is followed by the hymn: Sobä ṣäḥafä Däqsǝyos täʾamriha ʿǝludä ... "When Däqsǝyos wrote the collection of her miracles ..." (fol. 14va).
Text I-5 comprises 25 strophes which are strophes 2-10, 12-27 according to GrohHymn pp. 336-53.

supportDesc.condition: The leather cover is severely torn off from the back board and is damaged along the corners of the front board. The spine cover is missing, probably cut off to facilitate resewing. Textile inlay on the inner side of the left cover is missing. The Ms. has been resewn and the sewing has been replaced with several modern synthetic threads. Many fols. are misplaced, some are possibly missing. Many leaves are stained with water: e.g., fols. 7r, 14r, 20v, 28r, 54r. Text on some leaves is barely legible due to faded ink: e.g., fols. 3r, 8rb, 16vb, 34ra. Fols. 1-2 are undersized and serve as endleaves. Some leaves are held together by means of one-stitched repair (e.g., fols. 25-32 and fols. 33-54). Tears amended on fols. 36, 41.

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 3r (incipit page of Text I-1): simple ornamental band delimited by two parallel lines, with intersecting lines.

list.item:
Fol. 51ra: donation note. Fol. 51ra: ዘመጽሐፍ፡ … ቆስቋም፡ ዘወሀበታ፡ አመተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ይኩኖ፡ …ትኪ፡ አመተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡
The note is written in red ink and is partly illegible due to faded ink. It states that ʾAmätä ʾIyäsus, whose name is written over an erased name, is the donor of the book.

Fol. 54rb: donation note. Fol. 54rb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘማርያም፡ ጸበላ፡ ዘወሀበታ፡ አመተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በሥ[ል]ጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡
The note states that ʾAmätä ʾIyäsus donated this book to Maryam Ṣäbäla.

- The abbreviated title ተ፡ ማ is written on fol. 1r with azure paint. - Omitted letters inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 3va, 13vb, 19va, 24rb, 39ra. - Omitted letter added at the beginning of the line in the main hand: fol. 28ra. - Omitted letter added at the end of the line in the main hand: fol. 32va. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 8va, 20vb, 35va. - Immediate corrections indicated by dashes above and below the letters or the word: e.g., fols. 4va, 11vb, 28ra, 40rb, 43vb. - Lacunae (spaces for rubricated names left unfilled): e.g., fols. 23ra, 25vb, 47va, 49ra. - Pen trial: fols. 1v, 2r. - Scribbles in pen or pencil: e.g., fols. 1r, 2v, 23v, 51ra, 54v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlay in the inner side of the right cover. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and to the tail of the codex.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double circle, triple line fillet, criss-cross, wave form, cross hatching).

person.persName: Additiones 1 and 2 mention ʾAmätä ʾIyäsus as the donor. Several names are written in a secondary hand in the supplication formulas: Gäbrä Mäsqäl (e.g., fols. 15rb, 19vb, 25vb, 37ra, 39va), ʾAmätä ʾIyäsus (e.g., fols. 14va, 16vb, 30ra), ʾAmätä Maryam (e.g., fols. 16va, 23rb, 30rb) and Wälättä Haymanot (e.g., fols. 17va, 23ra, 40vb, 47vb).
